definition: lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: The company went to the end under his sole authority.
sentences.chinese: 公司在他的一手遮天之下走到了尽头。

sentences.english: Because do not have which big representative, have the capacity of hide the truth from the masses.
sentences.chinese: 因为没有哪个大代理拥有一手遮天的能力。

sentences.english: People who have power, they can cover up the sky.
sentences.chinese: 有权的人可以一手遮天。

sentences.english: No decision is made in a vacuum.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪个决定是总经理一手遮天。

definition: to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to be in a position of power
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
local tyrant
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
officials shield one another (idiom); a cover-up
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to support/to brace
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to do whatever one pleases
power/influence
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
